comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: Tram still running in Hunter St - closed 1948 - so prior to that. Not high enough resolution to bring up the cars in Hunter St, which would help.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/8793648@N06] Thanks for the info re the trams operating until 1948. That gives us a pre-1948 date here. I've swapped this with a much larger version which may help you find other details.

AB

comment.author: 76156998@N08
comment._content: University (Nesca) House is not built as yet in this photo.  The main part was completed in 1937, with extensions finished in the 1950's.  The Town Hall and Civic Theatre are both built and these were finished in 1929, so that should narrow down the date somewhat.

comment.author: 27331537@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/76156998@N08] Thanks! That gives us a post 1929 and a pre 1937 date so far.

comment.author: 8793648@N06
comment._content: I spotted a few mid-30s streamlined autos so probably towards the later date. Greg Ray has similar aerial photos of Newcastle in his second book, see catalogue.nla.gov.au/Record/5680674

comment.author: 76255137@N02
comment._content: Civic Railway Station appears to be complete (1936) and the triangular-shaped Northumberland Building Society HQ on the corner of Hunter and Burwood Streets is still there. It was demolished in August 1938.
